Rate formula: rate = distance / time

Distance traveled by the second skateboarder = 68 hours x 5 miles per hour = 340 miles 

Using the rate formula, we can find the rate of each skateboarder: 

Rate of the first skateboarder = 70 miles / 65 hours = 10.71 miles per hour

The principal difference between the lanthanide and actinide groups is their stability. 

The lanthanide elements, which are also known as the rare earth elements, are stable in their elemental forms and do not undergo significant radioactive decay. However, some lanthanide elements, such as lutetium and hafnium, are slightly radioactive due to their isotopes.

On the other hand, the actinide elements are highly unstable and undergo radioactive decay at an accelerated rate. All actinide elements are radioactive, and some of them, such as uranium and plutonium, are used in nuclear power plants and nuclear weapons.
